name: Eu Quero Presidente Pra Votar
Um Sogro Ruim Pra Cachorro
O Misterioso Sr. Bzung
A Mascote Que Dançou
Vídeo-Pilantragem
The Big Battle of the Golf Course!

description: Even though it says "nr. 7" on the cover, it was meant to be the 8th issue.

1. Pebbles and Bamm-Bamm - The Road to Riches - 8 pages

2. Pebbles and Bamm-Bamm - An Egg-Citing Day! - 8 pages

3. Squaro The Squirrel - Food Forgetfulness - 1 page text story

4. Pebbles and Bamm-Bamm - The Side Show King - 8 pages
name: The Road to Riches

description:
1. An Off-Color Heir (hosted by The Old Witch / written by Albert B. Feldstein : reprinted from: Haunt of Fear (EC, 1950) #21)
 
2. Dig That Cat... He's Real Gone! (hosted by Crypt Keeper / written by Albert B. Feldstein : reprinted from: Haunt of Fear (EC, 1950) #21)
 
3. Corker! (hosted by The Old Witch / written by Albert B. Feldstein : reprinted from: Haunt of Fear (EC, 1950) #21)
 
4. The High Cost of Dying! (hosted by Vault Keeper / written by Albert B. Feldstein : reprinted from: Haunt of Fear (EC, 1950) #21)
name: An Off-Color Heir

description: BRIGHTEST DAY continues, but in ways you can't possibly expect! What does BRIGHTEST DAY mean to the DC Universe? Is everything from here on out going to be bright and shiny? No, BRIGHTEST DAY means something else entirely, something we can't tell you...yet. But we can tell you our heroes will need to rise up more than ever to combat the forces of evil, and a select few will uncover a secret that binds them ALL.
name: Nuclear Options

description: They're cute, they're clever and they're obsessive! Some of Harvey Comics' biggest stars were three "little" girls with large dreams, enormous hearts and king-size laughs: Little Audrey, Little Dot, and Little Lotta. Audrey was a Paramount Pictures animated cartoon movie star, who became a major comic-book headliner in 1948. Her comic-book stories were filled with ingenuity and her spunky, proto-feminist antics rivaled those of her cartoon progenitor, Little Lulu. The strangely obsessive Little Dot has become a cult figure through the years. Her love of dots and her unique coterie of eccentric uncles and aunts became the basis for some of the funniest stories in comic-book history. Last, but hardly least, is Little Lotta who defied the "big" girl stereotype with adventures showcasing an incredible strength that equaled her insatiable appetite.
name: The Harvey Girls : Little Audrey, Little Dot & Little Lotta

description:
Newspaper comic strip reprints: Spider-Man, Batman, Modesty Blaise, The Phantom, Flash Gordon, Bloom County, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles.

In the Batman comic strip: costumed criminal Edward Nigma, AKA the Riddler, just can't catch a break. With a weak gimmick and a string of failures, he's the biggest loser in Gotham. That is, until he finds a briefcase loaded with over a million dollars! What he doesn't realize is that the case is stolen from the government, and also happens to contain a deadly biological weapon which could destroy the whole city!
name: Ft. the Riddler, Part 1

description: Newspaper comic strip reprints: Spider-Man, Batman, Modesty Blaise, The Phantom, Flash Gordon, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles, Latigo. Featuring the grand finale of the Riddler storyline!
name: Ft. the Riddler, part 3. W/ Latigo

description: Newspaper comic strip reprints: Judge Dredd , Spider-Man, Batman, Modesty Blaise, The Phantom, Flash Gordon, Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
name: Flash Gordon

description: It starts here! DC Comics proudly presents a ten-part history of the DC Universe spanning five generations of heroes from the dawn of the Mystery Men to present day. In this first exciting issue, the Second World War rages on, giving birth to a new breed of hero. Caped and masked urban myths become legends as they emerge from the shadows to earn their place in history. Meanwhile, explore the bizarre new heroes Dr. Fate and The Spectre and learn whether their powers are real…or imagined.
name: In the Beginning...; Snapshot: Reflection!

description:
The Dark Knight's oldest ally goes on a dangerous search for truth when evidence comes to light that a violent unsolved robbery costing dozens of lives was the work of cops!

Gordon gets called to a hostage situation in which several cops die and the perpetrators escape with millions. While investigating, he comes across a convict who strikes a deal in exchange for a reduced sentence, and claims that the perpetrators were dirty cops.
name: Dirty Deal

description:
With no one to trust and nowhere to turn, Gordon must go outside the Department to find help in ending rampant police corruption. But matters take a turn for the worse when Gordon's informant is killed in prison.

Gorodn calls in Shotgun Smith to help with the investigation of corrupt cops.
name: Suspicious Minds

description:
The conspirators uncovered by Gordon and "Shotgun" Smith strike back violently: Gordon is trapped in a sewer full of gasoline and Smith is abducted and strapped to a chair at the mercy of his captors.

Shotgun Smith is captured by the corrupt FBI Agent.
name: Night Country

description:
Gordon is all alone against the most deeply entrenched police conspiracy in Gotham City's sordid history. A dead body in his office leads him to the person behind it... someone very close to him!

Jim Gordon finally finds the men responsible for robbing a federal reserve bank and killing several police officers, and now all hell's about to break loose.
name: The Broken Men

description:
In The Savage Sword of Conan Volume 7, Conan faces brigands; magicians; gigantic mutated creatures; nameless, hideous demons; and a tenacious new foe -- the disfigured, metal-clad Captain Sharaq. Some of Conan's most unusual and exciting adventures are reprinted here, including "The Colossus of Shem," "Demons of the Firelight-Parts One and Two," "The Cave Dwellers," and others. These vicious tales are scripted by Michael Fleisher, Chris Claremont, and Bruce Jones, and drawn by some of The Savage Sword's finest artistic contributors, like John Buscema, Ernie Chan, Alfredo Alcala, Val Mayerik, and Joe Chiodo!

This volume, which collects The Savage Sword of Conan #72 to #84, also includes Conan covers, frontispieces, and pinups from each issue!
name: Volume Seven

description:
Continuing in the vein of the successful Chronicles of Conan collection series, Dark Horse is expanding its Robert E. Howard reprint line by presenting all of the original 1970s and 1980s Marvel color comic books featuring Solomon Kane in one awesome volume! This trade paperback features the landmark stories “The Mark of Kane” and “Fangs of the Gorilla God,” by Roy Thomas and Howard Chaykin, and the entireSword of Solomon Kane miniseries, by Ralph Macchio and a host of talented artists -- including Mike Mignola, Al Williamson, Bret Blevins, John Ridgeway, and others! From the French countryside to the Black Forest in Germany, from England to Africa -- follow Robert E. Howard’s solemn, driven Puritan, Solomon Kane, as he cuts a path of vengeance across the globe!

This beautiful 200-page tome includes meticulously recolored Kane adventures from Marvel Premiere #33 and #34, and the entire six-issue Sword of Solomon Kane series from the mid-1980s.
name: The Chronicles Of Solomon Kane
